title: Taiwan Imports YoY
description: Imports YoY in Taiwan increased to 8.20 percent in October from -2.40 percent in September of 2022. Imports YoY in Taiwan averaged 9.76 percent from 1982 until 2022, reaching an all time high of 114.70 percent in January of 2010 and a record low of -56.60 percent in January of 2009. A lack of natural resources had made Taiwan dependent on imports. Taiwan imports mostly parts of electronic products (18.2% of total), mineral products (15.2%), machinery (12.4%), chemicals (10.8%) and base metals (7.3%). Main import partners are Mainland China & Hong Kong (19.6% of total), Japan (17.6%), Europe (12.6%), USA (12.4%), ASEAN countries (11.8%) and Middle East (7.7%). This page includes a chart with historical data for Taiwan Imports YoY.
author: Ministry of Finance, R.O.C.
